repo.name: r3
repo.description: libr3 is a high-performance path dispatching library. It compiles your route paths into a prefix tree (trie). By using the constructed prefix trie in the start-up time, you may dispatch your routes with efficiency

readme.summary: Good code examples and clear basic usage, but missing critical installation steps and lacks troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions provided - only build/runtime requirements are listed without explaining how to actually install or build the library

injection_risks.description: Potential buffer overflow in str_array_append function due to lack of bounds checking on token length
Use of potentially user-controlled data in phannot_ret_literal_zval and other functions without proper sanitization or validation

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow in str_array_append function
Insufficient validation of user-controlled data in phannot_ret_literal_zval and other functions
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential buffer overflows and insufficient input validation, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: No releases in ~10 years (last release Nov 2015)
Build failures on macOS and Windows platforms
Lack of documentation and changelog for unreleased 2.0
praise_themes: Appreciation for library creation and past maintenance
sentiment.summary: Project appears largely abandoned with critical build failures, no releases since 2015, and unmaintained unreleased 2.0 branch causing uncertainty for potential users.

communication.summary: The responses are generally positive and encouraging, but could benefit from more technical detail.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being in December 2025
25 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no bug fixes
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process may be dormant
maintenance.summary: The r3 package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months, accumulating unresolved issues without any development or community engagement.

changelog.summary: The changelog marks breaking changes but lacks migration guides, clear categorization, and completeness.

project_metrics.description: libr3 is a high-performance path dispatching library. It compiles your route paths into a prefix tree (trie). By using the constructed prefix trie in the start-up time, you may dispatch your routes with efficiency

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and provides a good overview of the package's functionality, but could benefit from clearer installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months
Last release was more than eight years ago
Docs: Lack of clear and concise installation instructions for users who are not familiar with building C packages
Security: Potential buffer overflow in str_array_append function
Security: Insufficient validation of user-controlled data in phannot_ret_literal_zval and other functions
High bus factor risk (83% from top contributor)
highlights: Commits in the past six months
Contributors active in the past six months
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
